title: IS415 - Group 5
text:
Welcome to IS415 Geospatial Analytics and Applications - Team 5
This is our team’s Geospatial Analytics and Applications Group Project Website!

The Team
Daniel Chng - Daniel.Chng.2020@scis.smu.edu.sg
Leon Tan - Leon.Tan.2020\@scis.smu.edu.sg
Zoe Chia - Alanischia.2018\@scis.smu.edu.sg

title: Project Proposal
text:
Geographical accessibility and spatial interaction models are important considerations for any transportation network, and this is especially true for the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) and Light Rail Transit (LRT) systems in Singapore. These systems provide an essential transportation link for commuters across the city-state, and its accessibility can have a significant impact on the overall mobility and quality of life of residents.




Find out how accessible the MRT & LRT are for Singapore commuters.
Find out how well is the coverage of MRT & LRT services in Singapore.
Visualise how the locations of MRT & LRT are related with its surroundings. (e.g. School, Shopping Malls, etc.)





Mapping MRT & LRT Stations: A first step in any geospatial project on MRT & LRT accessibility would be to map the location of all MRT & LRT stations across the city. This can be done using a variety of tools, including GIS software and open-source mapping platforms like OpenStreetMap.
Population Density: Once the location of MRT & LRT stations has been mapped, the next step would be to map out the Population Density of Singapore residents.
Measuring Accessibility: The next step would be to measure accessibility. This can be done based on the max willing walking distance (300m to 700m).





Population Density

https://data.gov.sg/dataset/sample-household-survey-hdb-resident-population-by-geographical-distribution

Singapore Zoning

https://data.gov.sg/dataset/master-plan-2019-planning-area-boundary-no-sea

MRT & LRT Stations

https://datamall.lta.gov.sg/content/datamall/en/static-data.html
https://www.lta.gov.sg/content/ltagov/en/upcoming_projects.html#rail_expansion
https://data.gov.sg/dataset/master-plan-2019-rail-line-layer

Schools

https://data.gov.sg/dataset/lta-school-zone

Places of Interest

https://data.gov.sg/dataset/tourist-attractions






Data Preparation

Assemble data from various sources
Importing data
Data wrangling

title: zoe’s attempt
text:
Planning Boundary

planningBoundaryArea <- st_read(dsn="data/planning-boundary-area.kml")

Reading layer `URA_MP19_PLNG_AREA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\wamp64\www\IS415-Project\data\planning-boundary-area.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 55 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6012 ymin: 1.149527 xmax: 104.1192 ymax: 1.478359
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84



Plot

tm_shape(planningBoundaryArea) +tm_polygons()

title: zoe’s attempt
